revised_title: On the Mechanism of Vesicular Ice Stratification by Pressure
tldr: This article explains the process of vesicular ice stratification by pressure, demonstrating how the arrangement of air or water-filled cavities in ice is influenced by the pressure exerted on it. The author, William Thomson, uses his brother's theory and his own experiments to show how pressure causes ice to melt and refreeze in specific patterns, leading to the formation of layers perpendicular to the direction of pressure. This process is essential in understanding the formation of glaciers and their unique structures.
